rationale: Insurer denial noted and electronic appeal task recorded, but no mention of peer-to-peer call or Friday deadline.
HPI explicitly states the patient "has two syringes left."
HPI documents only a small bruise after last injection, matching requested outcome.
14-week gestation included but no reference to placental transfer or infant anemia concerns.
Order captures 48-hour delay and return to Saturday dosing, but omits the prohibition on 3-week extension and trough >5 µg/mL goal.
Note retains adalimumab 40 mg with no escalation but lacks daily self-monitoring details.
One-day delay with bowel symptoms documented; negative review for fevers, joint pain, visual changes missing.
Provides prenatal vitamin timing, bedtime aspirin, doxylamine-pyridoxine, and water/fiber advice; ginger chews not mentioned.
Appeal flagged urgent with OB letter and AGA guidelines; bilingual calendar upload noted. Missing 72-hour response, temporary override, voucher, QR code, and 24-h pharmacy confirmation.
No documentation of request for Chinese-character medication names.
Captures most key clinical and administrative points but omits several finer details (peer-to-peer, trough goal, ginger chews, Chinese character request).
No fabricated diagnoses or recommendations detected.
No unrelated chart data or extraneous history inserted.
Some key numerical/time details (peer-to-peer Friday, 72-h deadline) omitted, but others (2 pens, 48-h limit, 14 weeks) preserved.
